Documentation for the Code¶

Cosine Similarity¶

class ScrapedData.CosineScore.CosineScore(query, matrix)[source]¶

Calculate cosine similarity score for each document and rank them

Parameters:
  • query – query vector
  • matrix – tf-idf numpy matrix
getPages(start, end)[source]¶

To get the indices of the douments between the given ranks

Parameters:
  • start – starting rank.
  • end – rank after the last rank.
Returns:

list of document indices for ranks from start to end-1.

Process Documents and Queries¶

class ScrapedData.mycsv.DataPreprocessor[source]¶

Extract data from already scraped web data(stored in .csv files).

dataHandler()[source]¶
  1. Makes a bag of words(vocabulary) after tokenization, stemming, lemmatization & removal of stop words. (2) Makes a list of lists containing tokenized words of documents.
Returns:list of vocabulary of important words & list of all documents in the corpus
class ScrapedData.mycsv.TF_IDF[source]¶

This class will provide the functionality for all the postprocessing with the following tasks: 1. Process/Load the tfidf matrix (or update it) 2. Process the query 3. Then finally prove the user with the tfidf vector and the query

vector as attributed.
process_the_matrix(word_bag, doc_word_list)[source]¶

Processing the tf-idf matrix and save it as numpy compressed matrix.

Parameters:
  • word_bag – the unique list of the words which will comprise our dictionary.
  • doc_word_list – the list of the terms for each of the document in the corpus. list of list.
process_the_query(word_bag, query_word_list)[source]¶

This function will take a query from the user, then make a boolean encoding of the query in the space of the word bag.

Parameters:
  • word_bag – the list of the unique word in our dictionary
  • query_word_list – the list of the words in the query
